property.name: flink_download_url
property.description: Flink download URL. Flink will be downloaded from repository URL if this config is left unchanged.

property.name: flink_group
property.description: Flink group

property.name: flink_user
property.description: Flink user

property.name: jobmanager_rpc_address
property.description: The config parameter defining the network address to connect to for communication with the job manager. This value is only interpreted in setups where a single JobManager with static name or address exists (simple standalone setups, or container setups with dynamic service name resolution). It is not used in many high-availability setups, when a leader-election service (like ZooKeeper) is used to elect and discover the JobManager leader from potentially multiple standby JobManagers.

property.name: jobmanager_rpc_port
property.description: The config parameter defining the network port to connect to for communication with the job manager. Like jobmanager.rpc.address, this value is only interpreted in setups where a single JobManager with static name/address and port exists (simple standalone setups, or container setups with dynamic service name resolution). This config option is not used in many high-availability setups, when a leader-election service (like ZooKeeper) is used to elect and discover the JobManager leader from potentially multiple standby JobManagers.

property.name: jobmanager_memory_process_size
property.description: The total process memory size for the JobManager.

property.name: taskmanager_memory_process_size
property.description: The total process memory size for the TaskManager.

property.name: taskmanager_numberOfTaskSlots
property.description: The number of task slots that each TaskManager offers. Each slot runs one parallel pipeline.

property.name: parallelism_default
property.description: The parallelism used for programs that did not specify and other parallelism.

property.name: fs_default_scheme
property.description: The default filesystem scheme, used for paths that do not declare a scheme explicitly. May contain an authority, e.g. host:port in case of a HDFS NameNode.

property.name: high_availability
property.description: Defines high-availability mode used for the cluster execution. To enable high-availability, set this mode to "ZOOKEEPER" or specify FQN of factory class.

property.name: high_availability_storageDir
property.description: File system path (URI) where Flink persists metadata in high-availability setups.

property.name: high_availability_zookeeper_quorum
property.description: The ZooKeeper quorum to use, when running Flink in a high-availability mode with ZooKeeper.

property.name: high_availability_zookeeper_client_acl
property.description: Defines the ACL (open|creator) to be configured on ZK node. The configuration value can be set to “creator” if the ZooKeeper server configuration has the “authProvider” property mapped to use SASLAuthenticationProvider and the cluster is configured to run in secure mode (Kerberos).

property.name: execution_checkpointing_interval
property.description: Gets the interval in which checkpoints are periodically scheduled.

property.name: state_backend
property.description: The state backend to be used to store and checkpoint state. Supported backends are 'jobmanager', 'filesystem', 'rocksdb', or the <class-name-of-factory>.

property.name: state_checkpoints_dir
property.description: The default directory used for storing the data files and meta data of checkpoints in a Flink supported filesystem. The storage path must be accessible from all participating processes/nodes(i.e. all TaskManagers and JobManagers).

property.name: state_savepoints_dir
property.description: The default directory for savepoints. Used by the state backends that write savepoints to file systems (MemoryStateBackend, FsStateBackend, RocksDBStateBackend).

property.name: state_backend_incremental
property.description: Option whether the state backend should create incremental checkpoints, if possible. For an incremental checkpoint, only a diff from the previous checkpoint is stored, rather than the complete checkpoint state. Some state backends may not support incremental checkpoints and ignore this option.

property.name: jobmanager_execution_failover_strategy
property.description: The failover strategy, i.e., how the job computation recovers from task failures.

property.name: rest_port
property.description: The port that the client connects to. If rest.bind-port has not been specified, then the REST server will bind to this port.

property.name: rest_address
property.description: The address that should be used by clients to connect to the server.

property.name: rest_bind_port
property.description: The port that the server binds itself. Accepts a list of ports (“50100,50101”), ranges (“50100-50200”) or a combination of both. It is recommended to set a range of ports to avoid collisions when multiple Rest servers are running on the same machine.

property.name: rest_bind_address
property.description: The address that the server binds itself.

property.name: web_submit_enable
property.description: Flag indicating whether jobs can be uploaded and run from the web-frontend.

property.name: io_tmp_dirs
property.description: Directories for temporary files, separated by",", "|", or the system's java.io.File.pathSeparator.

property.name: classloader_resolve_order
property.description: Defines the class resolution strategy when loading classes from user code, meaning whether to first check the user code jar ("child-first") or the application classpath ("parent-first"). The default settings indicate to load classes first from the user code jar, which means that user code jars can include and load different dependencies than Flink uses (transitively).

property.name: taskmanager_network_memory_fraction
property.description: Fraction of JVM memory to use for network buffers. This determines how many streaming data exchange channels a TaskManager can have at the same time and how well buffered the channels are. If a job is rejected or you get a warning that the system has not enough buffers available, increase this value or the min/max values below. Also note, that "taskmanager.network.memory.min"` and "taskmanager.network.memory.max" may override this fraction.

property.name: taskmanager_network_memory_min
property.description: Minimum memory size for network buffers.

property.name: taskmanager_network_memory_max
property.description: Maximum memory size for network buffers.

property.name: security_kerberos_login_contexts
property.description: A comma-separated list of login contexts to provide the Kerberos credentials to (for example, `Client,KafkaClient` to use the credentials for ZooKeeper authentication and for Kafka authentication)

property.name: security_kerberos_login_use_ticket_cache
property.description: Indicates whether to read from your Kerberos ticket cache.

property.name: security_kerberos_login_keytab
property.description: Absolute path to a Kerberos keytab file that contains the user credentials.

property.name: security_kerberos_login_principal
property.description: Kerberos principal name associated with the keytab.

property.name: zookeeper_sasl_service_name
property.description: Override below configuration to provide custom ZK service name if configured.

property.name: zookeeper_sasl_login_context_name
property.description: The configuration below must match one of the values set in "security.kerberos.login.contexts".

property.name: jobmanager_archive_fs_dir
property.description: Dictionary for JobManager to store the archives of completed jobs.

property.name: historyserver_web_address
property.description: Address of the HistoryServer's web interface.

property.name: historyserver_web_port
property.description: Port of the HistoryServers's web interface.

property.name: historyserver_archive_fs_dir
property.description: Comma separated list of directories to fetch archived jobs from. The history server will monitor these directories for archived jobs. You can configure the JobManager to archive jobs to a directory via `jobmanager.archive.fs.dir`.

property.name: historyserver_archive_fs_refresh_interval
property.description: The refresh interval for the HistoryServer web-frontend in milliseconds.

property.name: custom_properties
property.value: # This is the place for your custom properties. # e.g. # your_key: your_value
property.description: The place for your custom properties
